meanings.definition: The state or quality of being extremely cold.
meanings.sent1: The gelidity of the ice made it hard to touch.
meanings.sent2: The gelidity of the snow-covered mountains took my breath away.
meanings.sent3: Despite the gelidity outside, the children still wanted to play in the snow.
meanings.sent4: The gelidity of her stare could freeze anyone in their tracks.
meanings.sent5: The gelidity of the frozen lake was a stark reminder of winter's grip.

meanings.definition: The act of freezing or becoming frozen.

meanings.sent2: The gelidity of the night caused the pipes to freeze.
meanings.sent3: The gelidity of the ice cream truck made the kids giggle as they waited for their treats.
meanings.sent4: The gelidity of his heart was evident in his cold demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The gelidity of the Arctic air was unbearable without proper clothing.
